Sarah Coles Spencer, the daughter of Mary Randolph Spencer of Richmond, Va., and Harold Rennolds Spencer of Warrenton, Va., was married yesterday to Basil Leonard Hurst III, the son of Cordelia Harrison Ward, also of Richmond, and Mr. Hurst Jr. of Newport News, Va. The Rev. Robert G. Hetherington performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Richmond.
Mr. and Mrs. Hurst, both graduates of the University of Virginia, met in high school in Richmond.

The bride, 32, is a freelance editor and stylist. Until July, she was the home editor of American Homestyle & Gardening, a magazine in New York. Her father is an investment adviser and branch manager, in Warrenton, at Wheat First Union bank. Her mother retired as the education director of the Science Museum of Virginia in Richmond.

The bridegroom, 34, is known as Beau. He is a senior vice president for business development in London with the asset management division of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette. His father is a sales representative in Newport News for the J. L. Hammett Company, a distributor of educational supplies.
